summary: Eldridge Cleaver was a prominent figure in the Black Panther Party (BPP). The documents indicate his involvement with the BPP in Algiers, where he experienced strained relationships with other members, including William Holder. He is mentioned in the context of American Black militants/hijackers operating between Algeria, France, and Switzerland, suggesting his involvement in revolutionary activities abroad. The documents span from 1969 to 1975, indicating his sustained involvement with the BPP during this period. There is no direct mention of Cleaver's involvement in the JFK assassination in these documents.
significance: The documents provided do not indicate any significance of Eldridge Cleaver in the JFK assassination context. His significance lies in his role within the Black Panther Party and his involvement in revolutionary activities during the late 1960s and early 1970s.
